title: Financial corporations; balance sheet
maintainer_displayname: ZBO | Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
name: financial-corporations-balance-sheet
notes:
This table consists of the balance sheet of financial corporations. It enables to compare institutional investors with monetary financial institutions, captive financial institutions and money lenders and other financial intermediaries and financial auxiliaries.

Data available from: 1998

Status of the figures:
Figures up to 2008 before revision are definitive, figures from 2008 after revision are provisional.

Changes as of 5 February 2015:
This is a new table that replaces the former table with the same title Financial corporations, balance sheet which has been placed in the archive. In 2014, Statistics the Netherlands has conducted a major revision on their macro-economic data. The national accounts have been compiled in accordance with the guidelines and concepts of the new European System of Accounts 2010 (ESA 2010). In addition, new statistical sources and estimation methods have been used during the revision. This table shows the figures from 2008 after revision, the figures up to 2008 have not changed. The break in series has been made visible by showing the figures in the balance sheet for 2008 both before and after revision. 
Compared with the archived table this table now also gives results for captive financial institutions and money lenders and for the total of financial corporations, this also for the period 1998-2008. The item Assets on the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is replaced with Special Drawing Rights (SDR's). The IMF member's reserve tranche position is now part of other deposits. This table no longer gives details of assets in equity and shares and of insurance, pension and standardised guarantee schemes.

When will new figures be published?
New figures for 2014 will be added in September 2015. Figures from 2008 will be adjusted when necessary.
